description: From Medieval Latin conventuālis, from Latin conventus (“convent”).

adjectives.description: conventual (comparative more conventual, superlative most conventual)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to a convent or convent life; cloistered, monastic.
examples: The Sunday Times has convinced me I ought to immediately start out on a new regime of positively conventual austerity in order to reduce the burden on a strained NHS by not forcing them to have to cope with my ling cancer or coronary.
